Package com.gsm.service.impl

Class UserServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gsm.service.impl.UserServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserService, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
    @Service
public class UserServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserService
    The concrete implementation of the UserService interface. Contains all business logic for user management and integrates with Spring Security.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        @Transactional
public UserDto save​(UserDto dto)
        Saves a user. This handles both creation of new users and updates to existing ones. It includes logic to check for duplicate phone numbers and to hash the password.
        Specified by:
        save in interface UserService
        Parameters:
        dto - The UserDto object containing the data to save.
        Returns:
        The saved UserDto object, potentially with updated ID or audit fields.

      • setActiveFlag

        @Transactional
public void setActiveFlag​(java.lang.Long id,
                          boolean status)
        Description copied from interface: UserService
        Sets the active status (active or inactive) for a specific user.
        Specified by:
        setActiveFlag in interface UserService
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the user to update.
        status - The desired active status (true for active, false for inactive).

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public java.util.List<UserDto> search​(java.lang.String keyword)
        Description copied from interface: UserService
        Searches for users based on a keyword (e.g., username, phone number, department).

      • mapDtoToEntity

        private void mapDtoToEntity​(UserDto dto,
                            User user)
        Maps the data from a UserDto to a User entity. If a new password is provided in the DTO, it will be encoded before being set.

      • convertEntityToDto

      • loadUserByUsername

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails loadUserByUsername​(java.lang.String username)
                                                                             throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
        This method is required by Spring Security's UserDetailsService. It loads a user by their username and returns a UserDetails object. We return our CustomUserDetails to include the user's database ID and their granted authorities.
        Specified by:
        loadUserByUsername in interface org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
        Parameters:
        username - The username to look for.
        Returns:
        A CustomUserDetails object for Spring Security.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if the user is not found.
        org.springframework.security.authentication.DisabledException - if the user's account is not active.
